text: Indian equity benchmarks declined for the second time this week, led by Bharti Infratel and Dr. Reddy's Laboratories. Both the S&P BSE Sensex Index and NSE Nifty 50 Index declined as much as 0.2 percent to 31,566.20 and 9,684.20, respectively.However, the market breadth was encouraging with about 863 stocks advancing, while 625 declined on the National Stock Exchange.
title: Stocks Radar:  Ajanta Pharma, Reliance Industries, MEP Infra, Wipro
